title: Can anyone indentify these fonts from InStyle magazine?
content:
I attatched a scan of the page from InStyle magazine. Can anyone help me identify the fonts from:

1. "Rihanna, INK"  
2. "Is it really enough?"  
3. "CUTE SKULL/MUSIC NOTES"  
4. and quotes

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [instylepage9.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20141115190439/http:/typophile.com/files/instylepage9.jpg) | 654.97 KB |
author: Brandon

comments.content:
1. "Rihanna," looks like some sort of Baskerville, and "INK." would be its italic, but I can't find one with an 'R' that has a bracket in the top left of the counter.

2. and 3. look like different weights of the same typeface, and I bet the '?' is key to identifying this one.

4. Is Georgia Italic.

- Lex

I think you're right. It's amazing how close Chronicle italic looks to Georgia.

- Lex
Dont think no. 1 is Baskerville...Although I cant say which font is it...

Yep, Akira you are right again...  
It definitelly is Austin...  
Although I liked older design of InStyle better than this new one... Although its not completelly new.
